MAA.name: Mahabalipuram Shore Temple Complex
MAA.description: Ancient rock-cut temples and monolithic sculptures.
MAA.notes: Located about 60 km south of Chennai. Day trip recommended.

MAA.name: Marina Beach
MAA.description: One of the longest urban beaches in the world, great for evening strolls and local snacks.

MAA.name: DakshinaChitra
MAA.description: Showcases the art, architecture, lifestyles, crafts and performing arts of South India.
MAA.notes: Located on the East Coast Road.

TRV.name: Padmanabhaswamy Temple
TRV.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, famous for its intricate architecture and spiritual significance.
TRV.notes: Strict dress code applies. Non-Hindus may have restricted access to inner sanctum.

TRV.name: Napier Museum and Zoo
TRV.description: An art and natural history museum built in the Indo-Saracenic style, adjacent to a well-maintained zoo.

TRV.name: Poovar Island
TRV.description: An estuary where river, lake, sea, and backwaters meet, offering unique boat rides.
TRV.notes: About 30 km from city center. Known for golden sand beach and floating restaurants.

TRV.name: Shanghumugham Beach
TRV.description: A city beach known for its beautiful sunset views and the sculpture of a mermaid (Matsya Kanyaka).

BLR.name: Lalbagh Botanical Garden
BLR.description: A famous botanical garden with a glass house inspired by London's Crystal Palace, diverse plant species.

BLR.name: Cubbon Park
BLR.description: A sprawling green space in the heart of the city, ideal for walks, jogging, and enjoying nature.

BLR.name: Bangalore Palace
BLR.description: An opulent palace built in Tudor style, inspired by Windsor Castle.

BLR.name: UB City
BLR.description: Bengaluru's first luxury mall, offering high-end brands, fine dining, and entertainment.

BOM.name: Gateway of India
BOM.description: An iconic arch monument built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary.

BOM.name: Marine Drive (Queen's Necklace)
BOM.description: A picturesque boulevard along the Arabian Sea, famous for its stunning cityscape view, especially at night.

BOM.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (CSMVS)
BOM.description: One of India's premier art and history museums, housing diverse collections.

BOM.name: Elephanta Caves
BOM.description: A network of sculpted cave temples located on Elephanta Island, accessible by ferry.

BOM.name: Colaba Causeway
BOM.description: A bustling street market offering everything from clothes and jewelry to souvenirs and street food.

DEL.name: India Gate
DEL.description: A prominent landmark dedicated to Indian soldiers, surrounded by lush lawns.

DEL.name: Qutub Minar
DEL.description: A soaring 73-meter high tower of victory, part of the Qutub complex with ancient ruins.

DEL.name: Humayun's Tomb
DEL.description: The tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun, often considered a precursor to the Taj Mahal.

DEL.name: Red Fort (Lal Qila)
DEL.description: A historic fort in Old Delhi, served as the main residence of the Mughal Emperors.

DEL.name: Chandni Chowk
DEL.description: One of the oldest and busiest markets in Old Delhi, famous for its diverse street food and wholesale goods.

DEL.name: Hauz Khas Village
DEL.description: A historic complex with ruins, a lake, and a trendy area with cafes, bars, and boutiques.
